required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study With the RM Pressfit Vitamys Cup in Combination With a Mathys Stem
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study With the RM Pressfit Vitamys Cup in Combination With a Mathys Stem

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is the evaluation of the clinical and radiological short- to long-term safety and performance of the RM Pressfit vitamys cup. The data will be used for an ongoing evaluation of the product safety and performance.

detailed_description.textblock:
Prospective multicenter follow-up study which examines the short- to long-term post-market clinical data on the safety and performance of the RM Pressfit vitamys cup. In total 675 participants in 9 clinics are included in this international multicenter study.
The primary endpoint of the study is the Harris Hip Score (HHS) 2 years after surgery.
The following parameters will be collected during the regular clinical and radiological follow-up: Harris Hip Score, radiographic evaluation and detection of adverse events.

primary_outcome.measure: Harris Hip Score (modified after Haddad et al, 1990)
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint of the study is the Harris Hip Score (HHS) 2 years after surgery. The HHS is a measure of dysfunction so the higher the score, the better the outcome for the individual. The maximum score possible is 100. Results can be interpreted with the following: <70 = poor result; 70-80 = fair, 80-90 = good, and 90-100 = excellent.

secondary_outcome.description: The second endpoint of interest is the occurence of osteolysis around the cup

arm_group.description: Participants treated with a RM Pressfit vitamys hip cup in combination with a Mathys hip stem

intervention.description: Implantation of a RM Pressfit vitamys hip cup

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed consent form (signed by participant and investigator)
- Primary implantation
- Age at inclusion: Between 18 and 95 years old
- Willing to participate in the follow-up
Exclusion Criteria:
- Missing Informed consent form
- Known or suspected non-compliance (e.g. drug or alcohol abuse)
- Enrollment of the investigator, his/her family, employees and other dependent persons
- Patient younger than 18 years old
- Revision surgery
- Presence of sepsis or malignant tumors
- Pregnancy
